accessibility.text: A full rank matrix,               , is one in which has N linearly independent column vectors (also rows). Two key implications arise from this:
Transforming the vectors space spanning    , the resultant set also spans      . So we say that the matrix                    .
A logical extension is that  A is a unique mapping, i.e.            has a unique solution, x, for all y         .
Matrices with rank < N are referred to as singular.
